snippet: Despite early indications that the holiday season would be lackluster, the 17 chains tracked by Thomson Reuters reported gains for the month above the 3.3 percent analysts expected.
abstract: Monthly sales reports show that many major American retailers were able to recover from slow start to December shopping, despite early indications of lackluster holiday season; 17 chains tracked by Thomson Reuters reported gains for the month above the 3.3 percent analysts expected.
lead_paragraph: Despite early indications that the holiday season would be lackluster, the 17 chains tracked by Thomson Reuters reported gains for the month above the 3.3 percent analysts expected.

headline.seo: After a Slow Start, Holiday Sales Improved
headline.main: After Soft Start, Holiday Sales Gained
headline.print_headline: After Soft Start, Holiday Sales Gained
